isis.stitle: NEWAY AD-123/246 DRIVE AXLE AIR SUSPENSIONS - MAINTENANCE - 5,000 MILES

step1.para: Inspect bolts and nuts at the pivot and axle connections to assure they are properly tightened. Check all other nuts and bolts for proper torque.
With vehicle on level surface and air pressure in excess of 65 psi, all air springs should be of sufficient and equal firmness.

note.para: The height control valve controls all air springs. Check all fittings for air leaks by applying a soapy solution and checking for bubbles at all connections and fittings.

step1.para: Suspension ride height is verified by measuring the air spring height. Improper air spring height could result in a poor ride or damage to the suspension and erratic vehicle handling. Refer to RIDE HEIGHT CAPACITY CHART. Final setting should be +/- 1/4 inch of the specification. If suspension air spring height is not to specification, refer to ADJUSTMENT.

note.para: Repeat this 5,000 mile inspection procedure every 50,000 miles thereafter.
